710996f-a.text:
46, 48-30, 32-4, 58-62 West Eight Street, south side, between Macdougal Street and Sixth Avenue: shops, grocery store and tenements, movie, night club, and lunch wagon, on one of Greenwich Village's principal streets. 46 West 8th Street replaced an 3-story stable, 52-4 was built around 1927, and the lunch wagon stands on the site of old 56 West 8th Street. See the closer view of 52-4 and 56, taken the same date. Of 58-60-62, only 58 is actually shown here.
May 24, 1933
P.L. Sperr
Neg. #556

710998f-a.text:
52-4 and 56 West 8th Street, south side, between Macdougal Street
and Sixth Avenue.
52-4 is a rather modernistic structure built about 1927, replacing the two old 3-story houses in the rear of which was Clinton Court. (This part of 8th Street was formerly also known as Clinton Place). The 8th Street Playhouse started out as the Film Guild Cinema, but has changed hands since 1930 and settled down as just a good movie theatre. On the floors above, the Knickerbocker Democrats of the 10th Assembly District will have their headquarters during
the municipal election of 1933.
56, a 4-story building standing where the lunch wagon is now shown, was taken down after 1930. In the summer of 1935 a 1-story store
will be built on this site.
May 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  Neg # 557

733314f-a.title: Street scenes - Miscellaneous.
733314f-a.text:
Street Scene, Miscellaneous: An organ grinders monkey and spectators
on West 8th Street at Macdougal Street.
May 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
733314f-a.folder: 8th Street (West) and MacDougal Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

721171f-a.text:
181 and 179 MacDougal Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of West 8th Street, showing two buildings that are to be demolished and replaced by a business structure. These were built in 1846 and occupied by "Gonfarone's" sometime in the 70's. For further data see the New
York Times of May 30, 1937.
May 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

721173f-a.text:
1. MacDougal & 8th St. Neg. A-244 May 30, 1941
P.L. Sperr, photographer

721170f-b.text:
(1)
179-181 MacDougal Street at the S.W. corner of 8th Street, the
northern end of MacDougal Street.
April 26, 1933.
L. Sperr.
These two buildings, a portion of the former "Gonfarone's" will be demolished and their site improved. For further information, see,
The New York Times, May 30, 1937.
(2)
The same, including the upper stories of buildings concerned.
May 1. 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Similar to No. 2 and showing in addition two buildings on the north side of West 8th Street at the head of MacDougal Street.
May 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
